content.question: A cart is moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis with its position, in meters, described by <math alttext="x equals, t squared, minus 6 t, plus 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is the time, in seconds, in the interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 6 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. Which of the following statements best describes the momentum of the cart in this time interval?

choices.label: The cart’s momentum changes direction at exactly one instant.
The cart’s momentum changes direction at exactly two different instants.
The cart’s momentum is not constant and does not change directions at any point in this interval.

content.answer: The cart’s momentum changes direction at exactly one instant.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
